casebody.data:
In the MATTER OF the SIXTH PRUDENCE REVIEW OF COSTS SUBJECT TO the COMMISSION - APPROVED FUEL ADJUSTMENT CLAUSE OF the EMPIRE DISTRICT ELECTRIC COMPANY; the Office of Public Counsel, Appellant,
v.
Missouri Public Service Commission and Empire District Electric Company, Respondents. WD 81627 Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District. ORDER FILED: March 5, 2019 Marc Poston, Jefferson City, MO, Counsel for Appellant. Shelley Brueggemann, Jefferson City, MO, Counsel for Respondent, Public Serv. Comm. Jennifer Heintz, Jefferson City, MO, Co-Counsel for Respondent, Public Serv. Comm. John Borgmeyer, Jefferson City, MO, Co-Counsel for Respondent, Public Serv. Comm. Diana Carter, Jefferson City, MO, Counsel for Respondent, Empire Electric Co. Before Division One: Cynthia L. Martin, P.J., Victor C. Howard, and Thomas H. Newton, JJ.

ORDER

Per Curiam:

The Office of Public Counsel (OPC) appeals a Public Service Commission (Commission) order which concluded that Empire District Electric's (Empire) hedging losses recovered from the customers were prudently incurred. We affirm. Rule 84.16(b).
